timelineEvents.title: Undergraduate Software Engineer Intern at Skyhigh Security
Computer Science Undergraduate Student at King's College London
timelineEvents.description:
My current home. Thanks to the cutting-edge tech and geeked out proffessors here, so far I've mangaged to broaden my expertise across many facets in the realm of computing, from writing test scripts in Java, to gaining a thorough understanding of databases, to even assembling my own Arduino!
I've probably learnt even more during outside working-hours: living on my own. Consequently, I've been blessed for the friends made along the way, whom together we've shared many stories and particpated in numerous social events.
Whether it's the 9am lectures, the 3am coding sessions or the 5pm tennis duels, there's always something to do in life at King's.

timelineEvents.title: 1st place in KCL Hackathon Blackrock Challenge
timelineEvents.description:
During this 9-hour event, we were tasked with creating an artificial trading bot system in Java. It barely passed the performance tests, likely thanks to our Chinese Remainder Theorem-oriented solution (read more about CRT @here https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_remainder_theorem@)
P.S. Special thanks to the TeamForA crew @Abu Bakarr Jalloh https://www.linkedin.com/in/abu-bakarr-jalloh-785305225@, @Zhiyuan Guo https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhiyuan-guo-90a19a2a8@, @Aniad Hossain https://www.linkedin.com/in/aniad-hossain-0aba6925b@ for the assist! :)

timelineEvents.title: A-Level Student at Dr Challoner's Grammar School
timelineEvents.description: Life at Challoner's was... extraordinary. Unlike my past experiences I was no longer near the head of the table academically; here you're just another guy, because you're surrounded by some of the most brilliant minds in the country, whether that's in front of or behind the teacher's desk. So it's no wonder that my enthusiasm and engagement towards the computing world flourished here. Wherever my future journey takes me, I'm pretty certain I'll never quite encouter an experience similar to being a Challoner ever again.

popup.title: My A-Level Results
popup.description:
Computer Science: A*
Mathematics: A*
 Physics: A*
 Extended Project Qualification (EPQ): A

timelineEvents.title: Awarded Dr Challoner's Taylor Prize of Mathematics Award
timelineEvents.description: To be totally honest I'm not sure why I got this award. Some may say that it's due to to how I performed in my year 12 A-Level mocks, but my cohort was geeked out of Mathematicians already. Anyhow, I'm grateful for it.

timelineEvents.title: Extended Project Qualification (EPQ) on the Socioeconomic Impact of Artificial Intelligence in the UK
timelineEvents.description: Writing the @5000 word report https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KBbrVlgioAfS-oyRFUFWDBfIzcjH3Ot0/view?usp=drive_link@ itself was the easy part, but the majority of my time was spent scouring the internet for insightful yet reliable primary and secondary sources. I also had to present my findings live to a panel of teachers and students, which is never easy...

timelineEvents.title: Participant of Royal Institution Masterclass of Computer Science at the University of Oxford
timelineEvents.description: Challoner's before Challoner's! Consisting of 6 sessions each summer, during years 9 (2018), 10 (2019), and 11 (2020), the program introduced concepts across many facets of computing (e.g. turtle graphics, game programming, bioinformatics), utilizing resources from the Department of Computer Science at the University of Oxford.

timelineEvents.title: GCSE Student at The Misbourne School
timelineEvents.description: Although it's true that The Misbourne didn't contain the brightest set of students, it was still the sanctuary for where my confidence thrived, plus I made some pretty awesome friends along the way. It's for that reason I'm forever fondly reminiscent for my time there.

timelineEvents.title: Primary School Student at Waterside Combined School
timelineEvents.description: Don't remember much, but I was there.
